page.title: 12Memories of old Rawmarsh
page.content: Rawmarsh Swimming Baths were built on the site of Rawmarsh Hall in the 1920s. Less strenuous recreation was provided by the{Rawmarsh Silver Prize {Band}and the 'Picture Theatres' where 'Flash Gordon' could be seen for one penny. There was also the annual fair held during the third week in August on the Crown Inn field between Green Lane and Pottery Street where the present Police Station is situated. Properly called{Rawmarsh Feast Week,}people tried to take their holidays then to enjoy the stalls and games such as hoopla, coconut shies and 'knell and spur' competitions. There was a little stand where peas were sold and there were donkey rides in a separate field. The feast week ended in 1936. Smaller feasts and fairs continued to be held but were not as popular.
